findings.title: RNRM - Redundant No Reentrant Modifier
findings.description: The contract uses the `nonReentrant` modifier to the `withdraw()` method, which suggests an intention to prevent potential reentrancy attacks. However, the `usdc` token is considered a trusted source within the contract and no external address can be executed through the `withdraw()` method, making the usage of the `nonReentrant` modifier redundant.

findings.title: IDI - Immutable Declaration Improvement
findings.description: The contract declares state variables that their value is initialized once in the constructor and are not modified afterwards. The `immutable` declaration can save gas by making certain optimizations.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The code does not adhere to the Solidity style guide, which can affect readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L19 - Stable Compiler Version
findings.description: The `^` symbol indicates that any version of Solidity that is compatible with the specified version can be used to compile the contract. The version lock is a mechanism that allows the author to specify a minimum version of the Solidity compiler that must be used to compile the contract code.
